alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Lake; Newton; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 10 at 2:57PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Widespread rainfall and localized flooding possible through the weekend... A strong storm system will move into the Midwest and Great Lakes region late this week bringing the potential for multiple waves of rainfall. Rainfall may be heavy enough to cause localized flooding of urban areas, poor drainage areas, and streams. This flood potential exists from late Wednesday through the weekend. Soil moisture conditions across the area range from below average to slightly above average. Many areas of northeast Illinois have experienced below average precipitation during the last 1 to 2 weeks, leading to relatively dry soil moisture. The driest soil moisture conditions exist in north central Illinois near Rockford, where drought conditions continue. A few areas in Lee, Ogle, Grundy, Kankakee, Lake, and Porter counties have experienced heavy rainfall during that period, leading to slightly elevated soil moisture conditions in isolated areas. Confidence is not yet high on the exact locations that will experience heavy rainfall, but it is probable that an east-west corridor of heavy showers and thunderstorms will develop Wednesday night somewhere in the general vicinity of northern Illinois and northwest Indiana. As the storm system nears the Great Lakes on Friday, additional heavy rainfall may occur. The general weather pattern and the forecasted pattern of rainfall is generally consistent with past heavy rain events in the region. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Persons should closely monitor forecasts including the possibility of flood watches, warnings, and advisories. An updated outlook may be issued by tomorrow morning.
